sentences.en: A high turnout was reported at the polling booths.
sentences.cn: 来自投票站的消息称投票率很高。

sentences.en: Election officials predict they'll set a new turnout record for an off-year election in Washington state.
sentences.cn: 选举官员预测他们将在华盛顿州创下非大选年投票人数的新纪录。

sentences.en: Election officials said the turnout of voters was low.
sentences.cn: 选举官员称选民的投票率很低。

sentences.en: Firemen are ready at all times for a sudden turnout.
sentences.cn: 消防队员时刻准备着紧急出动.

sentences.en: He gives little thought to his turnout.
I was disappointed by the turn-out for our home match.
sentences.cn: 我对我们主场比赛的观众到场人数感到失望。

sentences.en: I'll give my room a good turnout.
sentences.cn: 我要好好清扫一下房间.

sentences.en: It was a marvellous afternoon with a huge turnout of people.
sentences.cn: 那是个美妙的下午，出席人数众多。

sentences.en: On the big night there was a massive turnout.
sentences.cn: 在这个重要的夜晚，有大批人出席。

sentences.en: The concert attracted a large turnout.
sentences.cn: 音乐会吸引了大批的观众.

sentences.en: The high turnout was an affirmation of the importance that the voters attached to the election.
sentences.cn: 高投票率清楚地显示出选民们对选举的重视。

sentences.en: The turnout was at least 62 percent of registered voters.
sentences.cn: 至少有62％的登记选民参加了投票。

sentences.en: There has been a great increase in the factory's turnout this year.
sentences.cn: 今年这家工厂的产量提高不少.

sentences.en: There was a good turnout for the concert.
This year's festival attracted a record turnout.
sentences.cn: 今年的节日吸引的参加者之多创了纪录。

words.tran_cn: [经]产量；出席者；出动；清除；[公路]岔道

trans.tran_cn: 产量，出动，（集会的）出席者，到会者，[公路]岔道
trans.tran_en: the number of people who vote in an election
